alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; James City; Mathews; Newport News; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gloucester, northern Isle of Wight, southeastern York, southern Mathews, southeastern James City and southeastern Surry Counties, the City of Poquoson, the City of Hampton and the City of Newport News through 645 AM EDT... At 617 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Elberon, or 9 miles west of Smithfield, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Smithfield around 620 AM EDT. Fort Eustis around 630 AM EDT. Newport News, Patrick Henry Field, Christopher Newport University, Denbigh, Lee Hall, Beaconsdale and Grove around 635 AM EDT. Hampton, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences and Tabb around 640 AM EDT. Seaford, Gloucester Point, Achilles and Wicomico around 645 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rushmere, Pons, Lackey, Chippokes State Park, Ruff, Glass, Naxera, Oriana, Bethel Church and Ellis Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Gloucester; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; James City; Mathews; Newport News; Surry; York
